intro: Cecropia cobariana, commonly known as the silver ceiba, is a fast-growing tree native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and distinctive, clustered inflorescences. The plant has a robust stem with a hollow core, which is often used by animals for shelter. Its flowers are small and white, producing nectar that attracts various pollinators. Cecropia cobariana plays an important ecological role in its habitat, providing food and shelter for a wide range of organisms.
